intro: Anthyllis vulneraria f. glabriuscula, commonly known as the smooth anthyllis, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is characterized by its dense, low-growing mat-forming habit and is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Europe. The plant features small, yellowish-white flowers clustered in spherical heads, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are usually trifoliate, with small, rounded leaflets, and the stems are often covered in fine, short hairs. This variety is adapted to poor, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
